content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This goes very well with the Shortest Mode clash.

very easy , 
doable in less than one minute. 
but still, would be fine for CoC and even more for Golf. 
so little things to do that we'l have the time to try in different langages to optimise the length .
✅ Approved the contribution.

Some of my recent comments on another contribution of yours apply equally to this contribution. Would you please study them and avoid the same issues?

Please also follow the contribution guidelines:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

General
* Python-specific inputs and outputs should be avoided - that is one of the points stated in the link above.

Input section
* Please present the Input section properly by following the example in the contribution guidelines here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

In short, include line numbers, format line numbers and variables properly. Some of the detailed specifications should go to Goal section, while the constraints should go to Constraints section, so that Input section is less wordy and serves its real purpose.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar but must remain DIFFERENT.

Thanks.
I rewrote some stuff. Does this conform the contribution guidelines?

It's much better now. Thanks.

Just a comment on the wording: it's more precise to explain with reference to "characters" instead of "elements", i.e.

• "a string containing elements of any type" => "a string"
• "elements with the same value" => "characters with the same value"
• "order of elements" => "order of characters"
• "sequence of elements" => "string"
• "elements from the input sequence" => "characters from the input string"
• "consecutive elements" => "consecutive characters"

Also, "unique" may be a bit misleading somehow, because the final output may contain the same character appearing more than once.
Oh I seemed to have mist one. It's fixed now. Thanks.
